description: Caere (also known as Cisra or Cerveteri) was a major Etruscan polis located ca. 50 km north-northwest of Rome in southern Etruria.

history.comment: added bkiesling as contributor, added topostext reference

names.description: Pliny the Elder attributes the foundation of Caere to the Pelasgians, who named it Agylla.
